p: The injustice sensitivity scales (USS-8) of Beierlein et al. (2012) measure the four perspectives of justice sensitivity (victim, perpetrator, beneficiary, and observer). Each perspective is measured by two items, answered on a 6-point scale (ranging from “does not apply at all” to “fully applies”). An item example of beneficiary sensitivity is: “I feel guilty when I am undeservedly better off than others.” The reliabilities of perpetrator (Cronbach’s α = 0.82), beneficiary (Cronbach’s α = 0.89), and victim sensitivity (Cronbach’s α = 0.81) were good or even excellent; however, the reliability of observer sensitivity was questionable (Cronbach’s α = 0.68).
